This movie is about a man named Harold Crick who is an auditor for the Internal Revenue Service. One day while he was auditing a company called Chocker Industries, he suddenly finds that his mundane Chicago life to be the subject of narration only he can hear: narration that begins to affect his entire existence, from his work to his love life to his death.

As Harold Crick continues to experience the narration, it starts to affect him in ways he never thought possible. For example, he starts to notice changes in his own behavior and the way others interact with him. He also starts to experience changes in his own physical sensations, such as feelings of warmth or coldness, and even changes in his own thoughts and emotions.

As Harold Crick continues to experience these changes, it becomes clear that the narration is not simply a fictional story about a man named Harold Crick who is an auditor for the Internal Revenue Service. As he begins to understand more about the nature of the narration, he realizes that the narration is actually a manifestation of something far more powerful and mysterious than anything anyone has ever encountered before.
